Izard, 31, won the title of Top Chef during the season finale of "Top Chef", Bravo's reality cooking competition on Wednesday, ... more Photo: Chuck Hodes, AP James Beard Award-winning chef to visit Houston 1 / 5 Back to Gallery Any foodie who plans vacations by making restaurant reservations has no doubt put Stephanie Izard 's Girl & the Goat on their must-eat list when traveling to Chicago.
On Oct. 28 the Girl is coming to Houston. If you have any budding gourmands in your household, Izard's appearance at Macy's Memorial City will be of interest. The chef, who won Season 4 of Bravo's "Top Chef" in 2008, will hold a Halloween-themed children's cooking class at store's Home Department on Level 2 at 5 p.m. on Oct. 28. She will share Halloween tips, tricks and treats. Yes, there will be samples to taste. Yes, parents and their children are invited to wear Halloween costumes.
Seats may be pre-purchased for the class for $35 by calling 877-556-2297 through Oct. 28 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CST. With any purchase of $35 or more in the Home Department at Macy's Memorial City before the event will receive a reserved seat to the class, a $10 Macy's gift card, and a copy of "Girl in the Kitchen" which Izard will sign after the event, time permitting. The gift card is valid from Oct. 8 to Nov. 4. Izard's appearance is part of Macy's Culinary Council.
Izard opened Girl & the Goat in 2010 and won the James Beard Foundation award for Best Chef, Great Lakes in 2013. Two years after opening Girl & the Goat she opened Little Goat. She is close to opening the Chinese-influenced restaurant, Duck Duck Goat.
